Job Details

New ideas are all around us, but only a few will change the world. That’s our focus at JPL. We ask the biggest questions, then search the universe for answers—literally. We build upon ideas that have guided generations, then share our discoveries to inspire generations to come. Your mission—your opportunity—is to seek out the answers that bring us one step closer. If you’re driven to discover, create, and inspire something that lasts a lifetime and beyond, you’re ready for JPL.

Located in Pasadena, California, JPL has a campus-like environment situated on 177 acres in the foothills of the San Gabriel Mountains and offers a work environment unlike any other: we inspire passion, foster innovation, build collaboration, and reward excellence.

JPL Records Management and Archives

This group is responsible for ensuring that JPL meets NASA and Caltech requirements for managing the documents that record the Laboratory's projects and business. The group makes current and inactive records available for employee use, preserves significant records for future engineers and our Nation's history. This group also provides a central long-term repository for storage, retrieval, and distribution of JPL documents, records, photographs, videos, drawings and ephemera in multiple formats.

WHAT WE OFFER

As a summer intern you will receive guidance and support from the JPL Records Management and Archives staff to help strengthen your skills and develop your career path.  You’ll also build relationships and experience through networking events, seminars, tours, informational interviews, technical training, and more. This is your chance to join an innovative team that dares mighty things every day.

As an intern in the JPL Records Management and Archives group you will have the opportunity to participate in a series of ongoing projects, gaining insight into how the JPL Records Management and Archives group navigates our unique environment and audiences. Our objectives for your experience include:

APPLYING THEORY - Providing practical records lifecycle experiences through hands-on contributions to everyday operations (e.g. accession, processing, cataloging, arrangement and description, customer service/reference, etc.)

PROGRESS - Be an integral part of long-term archives projects and records processes. (e.g. microfilm processing, negative digitization/metadata cleanup, records storage requests, digital asset management, finding aid creation, document scanning, etc.). Tasks related to these projects will be tracked using current metrics tracking and assessment reporting.

INVOLVEMENT - Be a valued and contributing member of the Records and Archives group as we enact change in policy and workflows to strengthen the effectiveness of the records lifecycle at JPL.

In addition to a competitive salary, our interns are entitled to JPL’s holiday schedule with paid time off during any holiday that occurs during their summer internship. And who doesn’t like to have fun? We have a number of lab wide events just for our interns.

Required Qualifications

  • Interest in an Archives and/or Records Management career track.
  • Must be currently enrolled in a graduate program in Information Science, Archival Studies, Library Science, or related discipline.
  • Must have at least 1 quarter or semester remaining to complete degree.
  • Must be able to work full-time (40 hours/week) for 10 -16 weeks, starting in May or June
  • Minimum GPA 3.0.  
  • Must be able to provide writing samples.
  • Proficient with basic computer office software (word processing, spreadsheets), operating computers and scanners.
  • Must be detail-oriented, and capable of working in an environment that includes focused and repetitive tasks. 

Preferred Qualifications

  • Proficient with image and document scanning/editing software; OCR software; and handling TIFF, JPG, GIF, PDF, and PDF-A file formats.
  • Ability to work within a high-intensity learning environment.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills.
  • Understanding of basic preservation and conservation standards for archival collections.
  • Ability to work in a team environment; self-motivated and self-directed.
  • Library, Archives, Records Management, or related background/experience.
  • Experience handling and/or digitizing photographic film or other physical media.

The typical hourly rate for this job in Pasadena, California depending on education level is $31 in year 1, $33 in year 2, $35 in year 3, $36 in year 4

JPL has a catalog of benefits and perks that span from the traditional to the unique. This includes a variety of health, dental, vision, wellbeing, and retirement plans, paid time off, learning, rideshare, childcare, flexible schedule, parental leave and many more. Our focus is on work-life balance, and living healthy, fulfilling lives as we Dare Mighty Things Together. For benefits eligible positions, benefits are effective the first day of the month coincident with or immediately following the employee’s start date.

For further benefits information click Benefits and Perks
